isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - TWO PLATE CLUTCH REMOVAL - CLUTCH REMOVAL

step1.para: Install the spline aligning tool into the release bearing assembly and driven disc. An old transmission input shaft may be used for this purpose ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Disconnect External Clutch Linkage - Two Plate
Figure 14. Install Spline Aligning Tool - Two Plate

step1.para: Insert two 5/8" spacers between the flywheel ring and the release bearing housing. Spacers relieve the heavy internal spring load in the clutch assembly ( Figure 15 and Figure 16).

Because of the weight of a 14" clutch, the one-piece adapter ring and the strap drive intermediate plate, install two guide studs in the top mounting bolt holes to facilitate removal ( Figure 16). Loosen the mounting bolts around the flywheel in a criss-cross pattern to prevent cocking and bending of the clutch mounting bolts. Do not remove the bolts.
After all the bolts are loose, remove the mounting bolts and carefully remove the clutch assembly ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Insert Spacers Between Flywheel Ring and Release Bearing Housing - Two Plate
Figure 16. Install Guide Studs - Two Plate
Figure 17. Remove Clutch Assembly - Two Plate

step1.para: Remove the spline aligning tool and rear driven disc ( Figure 18).
Re-install aligning tool. Remove the one-piece adapter ring and strap drive intermediate plate. Finally, remove the front driven disc and aligning tool ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Spline Aligning Tool - Two Plate
